indications:
Indications prevention of deep-vein thrombosis
in general or orthopaedic surgery; thromboembolic disease in patients
with history of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia
name: DANAPAROID SODIUM
cautions:
Cautions recent bleeding or risk of bleeding; concomitant use of drugs
that increase risk of bleeding;  antibodies
to heparins (risk of antibody-induced thrombocytopenia); body-weight over 90 kg (monitor anti factor Xa activity)
doses:
Prevention of deep-vein thrombosis, by subcutaneous
injection, 750 units twice daily for 7–10 days; initiate treatment
before operation (with last pre-operative dose 1–4 hours before surgery)

Thromboembolic disease in patients with history of heparin-induced
thrombocytopenia, by intravenous injection, 2500 units
(1250 units if body-weight under 55 kg, 3750 units if over 90 kg),
followed by intravenous infusion of 400 units/hour
for 2 hours, then 300 units/hour for 2 hours, then 200 units/hour for 5 days
pregnancy:
Pregnancy manufacturer advises avoid—limited information available
but not known to be harmful
